text: Heinrich Friedrich Ludwig Rellstab (13 April 1799 â€“ 27 November 1860) was a German poet and music critic. He was born and died in Berlin. The first seven songs of Franz Schubert's Schwanengesang have words by Rellstab, who had left them in 1825 with Beethoven, whose assistant Anton Schindler passed them on to Schubert.Graham Johnson, "Ludwig Rellstab", 2000 His work was also set to music by Franz Liszt.A comprehensive list of texts by Rellstab set to music . He is also known to have given Beethoven's Piano Sonata No. 14 in C-sharp minor, Op. 27/2 its famous nickname Moonlight Sonata. ==References== Category:1799 births Category:1860 deaths Category:German poets Category:Music critics Category:Writers from Berlin
